briefTitle: An Study to Evaluate Rosuvastatin in Children and Adolescents With Familial Hypercholesterolaemia

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* children and adolescents (aged 6 to less than 18 years) with Familial Hypercholesterolaemia
* Patients aged between 6 and less than 10 years of age must not be taking a statin medicine

Exclusion Criteria:

* History of muscle or sensitivity reactions to any statin medicines
* Current active liver disease or dysfunction (except a confirmed diagnosis of Gilbert's disease)

outcomeMeasures.title: Percent Change From Baseline in LDL-C
outcomeMeasures.description: Negative values represent a decrease and positive values represent an increase. In total, 198 patients were treated. One patient received 1 dose of study drug but was not included in the efficacy and safety analyses due to a lack of follow-up data.

outcomeMeasures.title: Sexual Maturation by Tanner Staging at Baseline
outcomeMeasures.description: Tanner stages (I-V) was used to characterize physical development in children and adolescent. The stages was based on external primary and secondary sex characteristics, such as the size of the breasts, genitalia, and development of pubic hair. Tanner stage is considered going up when the organs grow bigger.

outcomeMeasures.title: Single Dose PK - Cmax
outcomeMeasures.description: Serial plasma samples were taken at baseline (Week 0) at: 0.5 hours pre-dose and at 0.5, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 9, 12 hours and on Day 1 at 24 hours after the single 10 mg dosing

outcomeMeasures.title: Percent Change From Baseline in HDL-C, TC, TG, Non-HDL-C, LDL-C/HDL-C, TC/HDL-C, Non HDL C/HDL-C, ApoB, ApoA-1, and ApoB/ApoA-1
outcomeMeasures.description: One patient received 1 dose of study drug but was not included in the efficacy and safety analyses due to a lack of follow-up data.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Max and Mean Carotid Intima and Media Wall Thickness (cIMT)
outcomeMeasures.description: One patient received 1 dose of study drug but was not included in the efficacy and safety analyses due to a lack of follow-up data.

outcomeMeasures.title: Adverse Events
outcomeMeasures.description: Number of participants with Various Categories of AE's. One patient received 1 dose of study drug but was not included in the efficacy and safety analyses due to a lack of follow-up data.

outcomeMeasures.title: Total Duration of Exposure
outcomeMeasures.description: Total duration of exposure was calculated as \[last dose date of rosuva - first dose date of rosuva + 1 day\]. One patient received 1 dose of study drug but was not included in the efficacy and safety analyses due to a lack of follow-up data.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percent Change From Baseline in Height
outcomeMeasures.description: One patient received 1 dose of study drug but was not included in the efficacy and safety analyses due to a lack of follow-up data.

outcomeMeasures.title: Sexual Maturation by Tanner Staging at Month 12
outcomeMeasures.description: Tanner stages (I-V) was used to characterize physical development in children and adolescent. The stages was based on external primary and secondary sex characteristics, such as the size of the breasts, genitalia, and development of pubic hair. Tanner stage is considered going up when the organs grow bigger.

outcomeMeasures.title: Sexual Maturation by Tanner Staging at Month 24
outcomeMeasures.description: Tanner stages (I-V) was used to characterize physical development in children and adolescent. The stages was based on external primary and secondary sex characteristics, such as the size of the breasts, genitalia, and development of pubic hair. Tanner stage is considered going up when the organs grow bigger.

outcomeMeasures.title: Single Dose PK - Tmax
outcomeMeasures.description: Serial plasma samples were taken at baseline (Week 0) at: 0.5 hours pre-dose and at 0.5, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 9, 12 hours and on Day 1 at 24 hours after the single 10 mg dosing

outcomeMeasures.title: Single Dose PK - AUC(0-24)
outcomeMeasures.description: Serial plasma samples were taken at baseline (Week 0) at: 0.5 hours pre-dose and at 0.5, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 9, 12 hours and on Day 1 at 24 hours after the single 10 mg dosing

outcomeMeasures.title: Overal Treatment Adherence
outcomeMeasures.description: Overall adherence rate was calculated as the weighted mean of adherence rates of all consecutive visits after baseline, in which the adherence rate between 2 consecutive visits was a percentage of the number of rosuvastatin taken divided by duration of exposure. One patient received 1 dose of study drug but was not included in the efficacy and safety analyses due to a lack of follow-up data.
